articles.title: Giant ‘dragon of death’ with 30-foot wingspan unearthed in Argentina
articles.description: Scientists recently discovered fossils in Argentina that belong to Thanatosdrakon. The specimens are the largest pterosaurs ever found in South America.
articles.content: Researchers in Argentina have unearthed the largest pterosaur species ever found in South America. Dubbed "dragon of death" by paleontologists, two giant flying reptiles were discovered in the Plottier Formation, an outcrop located in the province of... [4161 chars]

articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina (AP) — After a reprieve of months, confirmed cases of COVID-19 are surging in the southern tip of South America. But officials...

articles.title: Green light for return of red-footed tortoises to Argentina
articles.description: Last seen in the South American country 20 years ago, 40 are being reintroduced to El Impenetrable park in the coming weeks
articles.content: It may be one of the slowest-moving conservation projects in history, not just because of the red tape, but due to the animals themselves: 40 red-footed tortoises are being released into El Impenetrable national park in Argentina in the coming weeks ... [5402 chars]

articles.title: Argentine president pays 'fine' for birthday dinner during COVID lockdown
articles.description: Argentina's President Alberto Fernandez and the first lady on Monday paid a fine of three million pesos (about $24,000), in the form of a charitable donation, in return for legal proceedings against them being dropped over a birthday dinner during the pandemic lockdown that caused a scandal.
articles.content: Argentina’s President Alberto Fernandez and the first lady on Monday paid a fine of three million pesos (about $24,000), in the form of a charitable donation, in return for legal proceedings against them being dropped over a birthday dinner during th... [1864 chars]

articles.title: Daniil Medvedev cruises past Facundo Bagnis to reach French Open second round
articles.description: The US Open champion beat Argentina’s Bagnis 6-2 6-2 6-2.
articles.content:
Second seed Daniil Medvedev enjoyed a comfortable passage into the second round of the French Open with his opponent clearly struggling with an injury.

articles.description: Following is a summary of current science news briefs. Climate change boosted odds of recent deadly heat in India, Pakistan, scientists say South Asia's deadly heatwave in March and April was made 30 times more likely because of climate change, scientists reported Monday.

articles.title: Argentine president to pay fine for party during quarantine
articles.description: Argentina's president and first lady will pay a fine of 3 million pesos ($24,000) for hosting a party in July 2020 that violated the quarantine orders the head of state himself had ordered to prohibit group gatherings as a way to stem the spread of COVID-19.
articles.content:
The Associated Press

articles.title: FACTBOX-Monkeypox cases around the world
articles.description: * The UNITED KINGDOM detected 11 new cases in England on May 20, taking the total of confirmed cases in the country to 20. MIDDLE EAST * ISRAEL confirmed its first case on May 21. AMERICAS * ARGENTINA reported its first suspected case on May 23.
